commandSearch.window.title.notes: Title of the Command Search modal. We want Notion to be in there because this shows up at the OS level

desktop.tabBar.backButtonLabel.notes: Label for the button that goes back in the tab bar

desktop.tabBar.closeSidebarLabel.notes: Label for the button that closes the sidebar in the tab bar

desktop.tabBar.closeTabLabel.notes: Label for the button that closes a tab in the tab bar, followed by the tab title

desktop.tabBar.forwardButtonLabel.notes: Label for the button that goes forward in the tab bar

desktop.tabBar.loadingPlaceholder.notes: Placeholder message displayed in the tab title while we're fetching the actual title

desktop.tabBar.newTabButtonLabel.notes: Label for the button that opens a new tab in the tab bar

desktop.tabBar.openSidebarLabel.notes: Label for the button that opens the sidebar in the tab bar

desktopInstaller.failedToMove.detail.notes: Text of the dialog shown when we failed to move the app to the Applications folder
desktopInstaller.failedToMove.detail.translation: We failed to move the app to your Applications folder. Please move it manually.

desktopInstaller.failedToMove.title.notes: Title of the dialog shown when we failed to move the app to the Applications folder

desktopInstaller.invalidInstallDialog.ca.notes: Label of the Cancel button in the dialog shown when the app is not installed properly

desktopInstaller.invalidInstallDialog.co.notes: Text of the dialog shown when the app is not installed properly
desktopInstaller.invalidInstallDialog.co.translation: Your Notion application is not installed properly. Can we move your Notion app into your Applications folder?

desktopInstaller.invalidInstallDialog.ok.notes: Label of the OK button in the dialog shown when the app is not installed properly

desktopInstaller.invalidInstallDialog.ti.notes: Title of the dialog shown when the app is not installed properly

desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.notes: Menu item to check for updates. The ellipsis should be the Unicode U+2026 and not three periods.

desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.noU.notes: A message displayed in a little dialog when the user wanted to check for an update but there was none.
desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.noU.translation: You're on the latest version of Notion!

desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.tit.notes: The title of a message box displaying whether or not a new version of Notion is available.

desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.upd.notes: A message displayed in a little dialog when the user wanted to check for an update and one is available.
desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.upd.translation: A new version of Notion is available and currently being downloaded in the background. Thanks for staying up to date!

desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.upd.notes: A message displayed in a little dialog when the user wanted to check for an update but we failed to connect to Notion's update server.
desktopTopbar.appMenu.checkForUpdate.upd.translation: Notion failed to make a connection with the update server, either because of a problem with your Internet connection or the update server itself. Please try again later.

desktopTopbar.appMenu.downloadingUpdate.notes: Menu item to show that an update is being downloaded.

desktopTopbar.appMenu.preferences.notes: Standard macOS 'Preferences' menu. The ellipsis should be the Unicode U+2026 and not three periods. Ideally, if you have access to a Mac, this word should match what is present in the menu of other apps.

desktopTopbar.appMenu.quitWithoutSavingT.notes: Menu item to quit and exit without saving existing tabs on Mac

desktopTopbar.appMenu.restartToApplyUpda.notes: Menu item to restart the app to apply an update.

desktopTopbar.fileMenu.closeTab.notes: Menu item for closing the current tab in the current window

desktopTopbar.fileMenu.newTab.notes: Menu item for opening a new tab in the current window

desktopTopbar.fileMenu.print.notes: Menu item that allows user to print current page. The ellipsis should be the Unicode U+2026 and not three periods.

desktopTopbar.fileMenu.quitWithoutSaving.notes: Menu item to quit and exit without saving existing tabs

desktopTopbar.fileMenu.reopenClosedTab.notes: Menu item for reopening the last close tab(s) including their window if needed

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.openConsole.notes: Button that opens the developer console for the currently focused window

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.recordPerformance.notes: Used as the label for a button that triggers a performance trace recording
Label for the text field in a confirmation dialog that triggers a performance trace recording
desktopTopbar.helpMenu.recordPerformance.translation: Do you want to record a performance trace for the next 30 seconds? Once done, it will be placed in your Downloads folder.

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.recordPerformance.notes: Label for the 'cancel' button in a confirmation dialog that triggers a performance trace recording
Label for the 'ok' button in a confirmation dialog that triggers a performance trace recording
Label for the title field in a confirmation dialog that triggers a performance trace recording

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.resetAndEraseAllL.notes: Button that completely resets the app, as if it were just installed.

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.showLogsInExplore.notes: Used as the label for a button that shows the logs in Windows Explorer

desktopTopbar.helpMenu.showLogsInFinder.notes: Used as the label for a button that shows the logs in macOS Finder

desktopTopbar.historyMenu.historyBack.notes: Move back one page (similar to the back button in a browser)

desktopTopbar.historyMenu.historyForward.notes: Move forward one page (similar to the forward button in a browser)

desktopTopbar.historyMenu.title.notes: Menu for navigating the history of Notion documents

desktopTopbar.troubleshootingMenu.title.notes: The title of the menu that contains troubleshooting options

desktopTopbar.viewMenu.actualSize.notes: Menu item to let the user reset zoom to default (like a web browser)

desktopTopbar.viewMenu.forceReload.notes: Button that refreshes all windows, clearing caches in the process.

desktopTopbar.viewMenu.showHideSidebar.notes: Button to let the user show/hide the sidebar that shows pages

desktopTopbar.viewMenu.zoomIn.notes: Menu item to let the user zoom in all pages in the app (like a web browser)

desktopTopbar.viewMenu.zoomOut.notes: Menu item to let the user zoom out all pages in the app (like a web browser)

desktopTopbar.whatsNewMac.title.notes: The title for the link containing new desktop updates
desktopTopbar.whatsNewMac.title.translation: Open What's New in Notion for macOS

desktopTopbar.whatsNewWindows.title.notes: The title for the link containing new desktop updates
desktopTopbar.whatsNewWindows.title.translation: Open What's New in Notion for Windows

desktopTopbar.windowMenu.showNextTab.notes: Shows the tab to the right of the currently shown one (or loops around)

desktopTopbar.windowMenu.showPreviousTab.notes: Shows the tab to the left of the currently shown one (or loops around)

desktopTroubleshooting.showLogs.error.me.notes: When the `Show logs in Finder` fails, we show an error dialog. This message labels the message of that box. The message will be followed by the actual error.
desktopTroubleshooting.showLogs.error.me.translation: Notion encountered an error while trying to show the logs in Finder:

desktopTroubleshooting.showLogs.error.me.notes: When the `Show logs in Explorer` fails, we show an error dialog. This message labels the message of that box. The message will be followed by the actual error.
desktopTroubleshooting.showLogs.error.me.translation: Notion encountered an error while trying to show the logs in Explorer:

desktopTroubleshooting.showLogs.error.ti.notes: When the `Show logs in Finder/Explorer` fails, we show an error dialog. This message labels the title of that box.

menuBarIcon.menu.enableQuickSearch.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the Windows tray) that toggles whether or not Quick Search is enabled

menuBarIcon.menu.keepInBackground.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the Windows tray) that toggles whether or not Notion stays open when the user closes the last window

menuBarIcon.menu.launchPreferences.notes: A drop-down menu shown (when right clicking the icon in the Windows tray) that controls how Notion launches and runs

menuBarIcon.menu.openOnLogin.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the Windows tray) that toggles whether or not Notion opens when the user logs into their computer

menuBarIcon.menu.quitNotion.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the top left) to quit the Notion app

menuBarIcon.menu.selectCommandSearchShor.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the menu bar or Windows tray) that lets users pick the global shortcut

menuBarIcon.menu.showImmediately.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the Windows tray) that toggles whether or not Notion stays open when the user closes the last window

menuBarIcon.menu.showNotionInMenuBar.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the menu bar or Windows tray) that enables/disables showing that icon

menuBarIcon.menu.toggleCommandSearch.notes: Menu item (when right clicking the icon in the menu bar or Windows tray) that opens/hides Notion's AI-enabled search window

openAtLogin.dialog.detail.notes: Message for an error dialog informing the user that we failed to set the app's 'open at login' preference with the operating system
openAtLogin.dialog.detail.translation: {operatingSystem} prevented Notion from configuring the 'Open at Login' setting. This usually happens when Notion's startup has been configured in the system settings or if you have insufficient permissions. You can still configure this setting manually in the system settings.

openAtLogin.dialog.title.notes: Title for an error dialog informing the user that we failed to set the app's 'open at login' preference with the operating system

updatePrompt.detail.notes: Detail text for the dialog telling the user that a new update is available
updatePrompt.detail.translation: Would you like to install it now? We'll reopen your windows and tabs for you.

updatePrompt.installAndRelaunch.notes: Button to install an app update and relaunch the app

updatePrompt.message.notes: Message for the dialog telling the user that a new update is available
updatePrompt.message.translation: A new version of Notion is available!

updatePrompt.remindMeLater.notes: Button to remind the user later (1 day) to install their update

window.loadingError.message.notes: Dialog message shown to the user when there's an error loading a page.
window.loadingError.message.translation: Error loading Notion, connect to the internet to get started.

window.loadingError.reload.notes: Dialog action allowing the user to reload page that previous had a loading error

window.tabLoadingError.cancel.notes: Dialog action allowing the user to dismiss the loading error dialog

window.tabMenu.closeOtherTabs.notes: Right-click menu item to close all tabs except for the one clicked

window.tabMenu.closeTab.notes: Right-click menu item to close a tab

window.tabMenu.closeTabsToLeft.notes: Right-click menu item to close tabs to the left of the current one

window.tabMenu.closeTabsToRight.notes: Right-click menu item to close tabs to the right of the current one

window.tabMenu.copyLink.notes: Right-click menu item to copy the URL for a Notion page

window.tabMenu.duplicateTab.notes: Right-click menu item to make a new tab with the same page (i.e. duplicate it)

window.tabMenu.moveToNewWindow.notes: Right-click menu item to make open a new window with this tab

window.tabMenu.refresh.notes: Right-click menu item to refresh a tab's page contents
